data.event: By 1850, placer miners settled at the mouth of Gold Ca√±on, working sand bars deposited over the millennia along the path of the creek.
In 1857 many Chinese miners came to the area to avoid mining taxes directed at the Chinese in California.
By 1860 the town was primarily occupied by Chinese miners and it was called "China Town" in the U.S. census of that year.

event.title: was called "China Town" in the U.S. census of that year
